intro: Diodia barbeyana, commonly known as the Florida daisy, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist, sandy soils. Its showy white to pale blue flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture.
